title: Change the release process to leverage the ASF infra hardware & network
description:
After all of the recent discussions, seems like it only makes sense to leverage the ASF infra hardware & network. We ran into multiple issues during the release of 5.0 due to known reliability issues with people.apache.org.

As the INFRA issue that was created (INFRA-9170) to get that fixed was closed as "won't fix" with a reason that they don't support hosting releases on people.apache.org.

Important NOTE: This is related but orthogonal to reducing artifacts size or retrying downloads.

comments.author: Hoss Man
comments.content: see comments in LUCENE-5589 for some discussion about how the dist repo's "dev" directory (designed for hosting release candidates) could be leveraged by our release process, and simplify the "publish" process for artifacts (it just becomes remove "svn mv" commands)
